# xelon_ssh_key (Data Source)

The SSH key data source provides information about an existing SSH key.

SSH keys can be injected into devices during creation for secure authentication.

## Example Usage

### Using name

```terraform
data "xelon_ssh_key" "admin" {
  name = "admin-key"
}

resource "xelon_device" "web" {
  ssh_key_id = data.xelon_ssh_key.admin.id
  # ... other configuration
}
```

### Using ID

```terraform
data "xelon_ssh_key" "admin" {
  id = "key-12345"
}
```

### Using ID and name for validation

```terraform
data "xelon_ssh_key" "admin" {
  id   = "key-12345"
  name = "admin-key"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `id` (String) The ID of the SSH key.
- `name` (String) The SSH key name.

### Read-Only

- `public_key` (String) The public SSH key content.
